title: Disney Reports More Than 28 Million Subscribers to Disney+
summary: User base of Disney+ more than doubled since launching in November. Walt Disney Co. emerged as a formidable contender in a rapidly escalating battle among online-video platforms, as the number of subscribers to its new streaming service more than doubled in its first three months.

title: A Greater Britain After Brexit
summary: Ignore the doubters. An economic growth spurt is possible.. Britain left the European Union last week, but the event isn't quieting defeatists insisting that Brexit will be an economic disaster. They've been rounding on Chancellor Sajid Javid for thinking big about the U.K.'s future.

title: China's Taiwan Quarantine
summary: Beijing wants to exclude the island from crucial coronavirus cooperation.. The novel coronavirus has killed at least 425 people and sickened some 20,000. No vaccine exists. Yet amid this public-health emergency, China is playing power politics at the world's peril in its treatment of Taiwan.

title: Democrats Call for End of Iowa Caucuses After Results Debacle
summary: Iowa Democratic Party still hadn't released results Tuesday afternoon. DES MOINES, Iowa-The results debacle surrounding Iowa's presidential caucuses is threatening to end the decadeslong tradition of starting the nomination race in a state already long criticized for having such an outsize role despite its small, mostly white population.

title: Stop Bernie Sanders Now
summary: The socialist senator's extreme positions will lead to Democratic disaster in November.. As Iowa Democrats streamed into their local caucuses Monday evening, they told pollsters by a margin of 61% to 37% that they would rather see the Democratic Party nominate a presidential candidate who can "beat Donald Trump" than one who "agrees with you on major issues." But according to partial returns released Tuesday afternoon, their votes have made Sen. Bernie Sanders once again a leading candidate for the Democratic nomination.

title: Tesla's Stock Goes to Heaven
summary: In the automobile business, miracles are few and rightly suspect.. In case you're puzzled why Tesla's stock is up 200% in three months, don't be. It's amazing what running a business like a business sometimes can accomplish. Imagine that the faith and hope that animated Tesla bulls is still intact, but the following also happened: Tesla chief Elon Musk stopped relying on government policy to make his company successful. He refrained from overpromising. He became disciplined about costs and tweeting. He backed away from selling his Model 3 to the masses at $35,000. Instead, he focused on selling $70,000 versions to high rollers and enthusiasts.

title: Empty Prisons Mean Dangerous Streets
summary: On both sides of the Atlantic, a raft of soft-on-crime policies are putting people at risk.. After a second stabbing spree by a paroled jihadist in less than three months, the British government is reconsidering its early-release policies for people convicted of terrorist acts. Bully for the Brits, but what's taken them so bloody long?

title: How Will You Remember Kobe?
summary: Students explain what the larger-than-life basketball star meant to them.. Editor's note: This Future View is about the legacy Kobe Bryant leaves behind. Next week we'll ask, "What do Bernie Sanders's young supporters see in him? Alternatively, what do they miss?" Students should click here to submit opinions of fewer than 250 words before Feb. 11. The best responses will be published that night.

title: Socialism Strikes Back
summary: Before many Sanders voters were born, I saw his ideology in action in the Soviet Union and Britain.. Socialist Bernie Sanders's emergence as a front-runner for the Democratic presidential nomination is puzzling to many of us who have experienced socialism. We thought it dead-good riddance-when the Soviet empire collapsed 30 years ago. Our mistake.

title: Brazil's Odebrecht Agrees to Extend Monitorship for Another Nine Months
summary: The Brazilian construction company agreed to retain an independent compliance monitor as part of its 2016 plea agreement with the Justice Department. Brazilian construction giant Odebrecht SA has agreed to extend the monitorship and other terms of its plea agreement with the U.S. Justice Department for almost nine months, according to court filings.

title: Stop a U.S. Coronavirus Outbreak Before It Starts
summary: It's time to start testing patients with unexplained pneumonia, even if they haven't traveled to China.. The Wuhan coronavirus continues to spread at an alarming rate. More than 20,000 cases have been confirmed in China, with another 23,000 suspected. Many in China aren't even being tested due to a shortage of diagnostic supplies. The true number infected is likely much higher than reported. The virus has turned up in 28 other countries, including the U.S. A pandemic seems inevitable.

title: New Hampshire Wins the Iowa Caucuses
summary: In the Granite State, we know how to run an election. The Hawkeye State should step aside.. Concord, N.H.

title: Notable & Quotable: Math and Social Justice
summary: 'Students were able to appreciate the complexities of fairness, the deep inequities that capitalism produces, and questioned the idea that mathematics is politically neutral.'. Tian An writing on the website of the American Mathematical Society, Jan. 31:

title: WW and CVS Used to Stand for Something
summary: Abbreviated company names are all the rage across the USA.. Corporate America has, over decades, discarded words and gravitated to letters. The internet is partly responsible-after all, it's much easier to type aa.com than americanairlines.com, although they both take you to the same website. When Weight Watchers recently became WW, it opted for a mundane new name but a winning URL, ww.com.

title: 'Eight Days at Yalta' Review: A Complicated Betrayal
summary: Today's condemnations of the deliberations at Yalta fail to do justice to the constraints under which the protagonists labored.. Seventy-five years after Winston Churchill, Franklin Roosevelt and Joseph Stalin came together for the second and final time, the Crimean city that hosted their wartime deliberations has become synonymous with betrayal. Today Yalta, like Munich, stands for the sellout of Eastern Europe, the nadir of Western diplomatic weakness and shame.

title: Race Moves to New Hampshire as Iowa Remains in Flux
summary: Sanders, Buttigieg, Warren and Biden are in tight race leading up to state's Democratic primary vote. LACONIA, N.H.-Democratic presidential candidates arrived in New Hampshire with busy campaign schedules but locked in a race denied any clear sense of direction by the caucus problems in Iowa.

title: Ford's Operating Income Falls by Two-Thirds
summary: Auto maker cites lower production volumes in North America. Ford Motor Co. said fourth-quarter operating income sank by two-thirds, and it issued a lower-than-expected profit outlook for 2020, the latest signs of trouble for Chief Executive Jim Hackett's turnaround plan.

title: Chipotle Reports Sales Gains As Costs Rise
summary: Comparable restaurant sales rose 13.4% in the fourth quarter. Chipotle Mexican Grill Inc. said it drummed up higher digital sales and more expensive orders, lifting profit even as costs rose.

title: After Iowa Muddle, Bloomberg to Double Ad Spending
summary: Billionaire Democrat's campaign is aiming at Super Tuesday states-and beyond. Former New York City Mayor Michael Bloomberg's presidential campaign is trying to use the chaos surrounding the Iowa caucus results to its advantage, doubling its spending on ads and ramping up its organizing.

title: Disney Earns Its Bounty
summary: The latest results show Disney+ users aren't bailing following the conclusion of 'The Mandalorian'. Walt Disney Co. is well accustomed to getting butts into seats. The entertainment giant is now showing some skill at keeping them there.

title: U.S. Pushing Effort for 5G Networks Without Huawei
summary: Companies including Dell, Microsoft and AT&T are part of the effort, White House economic advisor Larry Kudlow says. WASHINGTON-Seeking to blunt the dominance of China's Huawei Technologies Co., the White House is working with U.S. technology companies to create advanced software for next-generation 5G telecommunications networks.

title: Testing Could Have Prevented Iowa Caucus App Failure, Experts Say
summary: Due diligence including field and user tests should have uncovered problems with Shadow app, according to IT officials. A glitch in a mobile app used to transmit results from the Iowa presidential caucuses Monday could have been avoided with basic due diligence, chief information officers, analysts and researchers said.

title: Market's Favorite Recession Signal Probably Has It Wrong
summary: Fears over the coronavirus outbreak have pushed the yield curve negative, but this may reflect something more benign. The market's most-popular recession warning is flashing red again as fears about the economic impact of China's coronavirus outbreak prompt a big drop in Treasury yields.

title: COSO Warns of the Downside of Siloing Risk Managers
summary: New guidance from the advisory group emphasizes the role of risk management in maximizing growth. An influential organization that advises companies on risk management is urging corporate boards and senior executives to incorporate risk analyses into high-level decision-making.

title: New York City Police Commissioner Blames New Bail Law for Rising Crime
summary: Serious crimes in the city rose 16.9% in January compared with the same time a year ago, the NYPD says. Serious crimes rose in New York City after a law to free defendants awaiting trial took effect at the start of the year, New York City Police Commissioner Dermot Shea said Tuesday.

title: Clorox Punished for Raising Glad Prices
summary: Retailers responded by cutting back on shelf space, reducing sales for household unit. Clorox Co. executives were certain stores wouldn't revolt over price hikes on Glad products from trash bags to freezer wraps.

title: Ex-CIA Employee Wrongly Blamed for Leak, Defense Argues
summary: Joshua Adam Schulte's attorney said the government doesn't really know how a trove of classified information got to WikiLeaks. Federal prosecutors have unfairly blamed a former Central Intelligence Agency employee for the 2017 disclosure of a trove of CIA hacking tools, the former employee's lawyer told a federal jury Tuesday.

title: Ferrari Wants to Save the Planet, Too
summary: The Italian racing car maker launched its first plug-in hybrid last year and is even talking about carbon neutrality. There are two astronomically valued auto stocks out there: Tesla , which makes quiet-driving electric vehicles, and Ferrari , which makes famously noisy racing cars.

title: Bond Investors Eye Iowa Caucuses
summary: Policy differences between candidates could spark swings in markets ahead of general election. The yield on the benchmark 10-year Treasury posted its largest one-day gain in nearly two months Tuesday, lifted by economic stimulus in China, signs of recovery in manufacturing and the stalled release of results from the Iowa Democratic caucuses.

title: Macy's Planning Larger-Than-Expected Office Tower Atop Flagship Store
summary: Resume Subscription. Macy's Inc. offered new details about plans to build an office tower atop its flagship Manhattan store, which likely would include public improvements to the Herald Square neighborhood and more office space than previously reported.

title: Bombardier in Talks to Sell Business-Jet Unit to Textron
summary: The struggling Canadian train and plane maker is aiming to pare its debts. Bombardier Inc. is in talks to sell its business-jet division to Textron Inc. as the struggling Canadian train and plane maker moves to pare its debts, people familiar with the matter said.

title: Stocks Rally as Volatility Makes Comeback
summary: U.S. benchmarks add 1.4% or more as investors bet on economic resilience; Nasdaq closes at record. The Dow Jones Industrial Average climbed more than 400 points Tuesday as volatility regained a foothold in the market and investors bet that global growth will survive the coronavirus outbreak in China.

title: Yale Changes Its Introduction to Art History
summary: That introductory class gave such a sweeping, engaging, diversely relevant view of Western culture that it was frequented by budding physicists, engineers and actors as much as by future art historians.. Regarding Roger Kimball's "Civilization Is History at Yale" (op-ed, Jan. 30): The art history survey course which is the latest casualty of Yale's PC revolution was an undergraduate favorite of mine-and not just mine, as the packed lecture hall and frequent standing ovations made clear, year after year. Art history is the quintessence of the liberal arts, encompassing aesthetics, philosophy, political history, geography, even chemistry; that introductory class gave such a sweeping, engaging, diversely relevant view of Western culture that it was frequented by budding physicists, engineers and actors as much as by future art historians. Given its profound impact on generations of Yalies, it makes perfect sense that Yale President Peter Salovey would approve eliminating the class.

title: Free Counseling for All Distressed Clothes?
summary: I never could quite figure out how dressing as if you were from a poor family became cool.. "Say Yes to Distressed?" (Off Duty, Jan. 25) is a real blast to the past. In high school in 1962, at the urging of my biology teacher, I applied for a special "gifted student" summer-school program in biology sponsored by the National Science Foundation. I was one of 15 accepted nationwide. So my parents canceled the summer vacation and pinched the pennies even harder to pay for the travel and out-of-pocket expenses.

title: You Can Print and Borrow Money Until You Can't
summary: Disciples of modern monetary theory will rue discovering we cannot repay our foreign creditors $1 of debt by printing even three new Continentals.. Nick Estes's arguments are founded on quicksand, to wit: "Treasurys are completely marketable" and "The debt can always be paid by creating money" ("An Explanation of Modern Monetary Theory," Letters, Jan. 22). Both are true-until they are not. Mr. Estes concludes with a false array of choices: "We should worry about fighting climate change and injustice, not about the national debt." For ourselves and generations to follow, we best worry about and courageously battle all three. With regard to the national debt, Mr. Estes is dead wrong.

title: Service-Animal Use Abuse: Time to Take a Hard Look
summary: Three-quarters into the flight, the German Shepherd began to wail, and no matter what the flight attendants tried, the wailing continued-nonstop.. Jason Haag's "Phony Service Dogs Hurt Veterans" (op-ed, Jan. 27) about the Transportation Department issuing a ruling that will keep untrained pets off planes and the importance of trained service dogs was on the mark.

title: Two Cheers for U.S. Pharma
summary: Thank God for Big Pharma developing vaccines with all sorts of federal protection that other industries, even those in health care, don't enjoy.. Regarding your editorial "Pharma to the Rescue" (Jan. 31): Thank God for Big Pharma developing vaccines with all sorts of federal protection that other industries, even those in health care, don't enjoy. This still doesn't explain the cost differences of drugs in the U.S. and elsewhere.

title: Avianca Opens Probe Following Airbus Bribery Settlement
summary: The Colombian airline group has retained a law firm to investigate its business relationship with the European plane maker. A Colombian airline group has opened a probe into its business relationship with Airbus SE after the European plane maker reached a record $4 billion bribery settlement with authorities in three countries.

title: Centene's Profit Dented by Higher Costs
summary: The St. Louis-based insurance company posted net income of 49 cents a share, compared with 57 cents in the same period a year prior. Centene Corp. said its fourth-quarter profit fell as expenses increased, though revenue rose.

title: PG&E Wins Court Approval on Bankruptcy Pact With Bondholders
summary: Settlement with bondholders ends threat of a rival chapter 11 plan for the embattled California utility. PG&E Corp. won court approval of a settlement with bondholders that had threatened to derail its bankruptcy strategy.

title: 'Taking Shape: Abstraction From the Arab World, 1950s-1980s' Review: A History of Flux and Formation
summary: Running through the exhibition is a vibrant interplay among numerous sources and voices..

title: Gold Slides as Fears Tied to Virus Abate
summary: Prices have dropped since hitting a nearly seven-year high last week. Gold prices fell sharply Tuesday, paring some of their recent advance, with traders expecting the Chinese central bank's moves to inject liquidity into the country's banking system to help the economy stabilize following the coronavirus outbreak.

title: Justice Department's Antitrust Chief Recuses Himself From Google Probe
summary: Department cites Makan Delrahim's past work with search giant. WASHINGTON-The Justice Department's chief antitrust enforcement official has recused himself from the department's investigation into whether Alphabet Inc.'s Google is unlawfully suppressing competition.

title: 'Unseen: 35 Years of Collecting Photographs' Review: A Different Perspective
summary: The Getty Museum dives into its expansive photography collection to reveal lesser-known works by famous practitioners.. Los Angeles

title: Trump's State of the Union Address: What Time It Is and How to Watch It
summary: President's address to Congress starts at 9 p.m. Eastern time. Follow our streaming video and live analysis. President Trump delivers his third State of the Union address Tuesday to a Congress divided over his impeachment.

title: Royal Caribbean Expects Coronavirus to Weigh on China Sales
summary: Miami-based cruise operator says outbreak could cost it more than $50 million in lost revenue. Royal Caribbean Cruises Ltd. said the coronavirus outbreak, which has spurred governments and corporations to restrict travel to and from China, could cost it more than $50 million in lost revenue.

title: China Marshals Its Surveillance Powers Against Coronavirus
summary: Officials use big data to track the movements of infected individuals. In January, a person infected with the dangerous new Wuhan coronavirus used public transportation to crisscross the eastern Chinese city of Nanjing, potentially exposing those along the way to the highly contagious pathogen.

title: Are Taxidermy Animals Tasteless?
summary: Interior designers lock horns over using mounted beasts in décor. Some see them as celebrating the natural world, others see them as violating it. FOR MANY ski-home owners, displaying game native to a region affirms man's long hard climb up the food chain. "In the West, elk, antelope and deer are plentiful," said Santa Fe, N.M., designer Jet Zarkadas. "There is an honor, if you are a meat eater, in killing your own game."

title: Hearing on Barnard Killing Touches on Shoes in Surveillance Video
summary: Teenage suspect recognized sneakers, NYPD officer testifies. A 13-year-old suspect accused of a role in the fatal stabbing of a Barnard College student told investigators that his shoes looked like ones worn by a person in surveillance video taken near the murder scene, a New York Police Department officer said Tuesday.

title: Goldman Executive Exits After Barred From Banking Over 1MDB Scandal
summary: Andrea Vella permanently barred for his role in Goldman's financing of a multibillion-dollar fraud involving a sovereign-wealth fund. WASHINGTON-A senior Goldman Sachs Group Inc. executive left the firm after the Federal Reserve punished him for his role in a Malaysian corruption scandal that has tarnished Goldman's reputation.

title: Jeff Bezos Pushes for Immediate Dismissal of Defamation Suit
summary: Amazon.com founder's lawyers say his girlfriend's brother was the source of leaked personal text messages for the National Enquirer. Amazon.com Inc. founder Jeff Bezos asked a California judge to throw out a defamation lawsuit against him, saying he didn't accuse his girlfriend's brother of leaking nude photos.

title: BP's Big Dividends Come With Costs
summary: Raising the payout adds to the incoming chief executive's challenges as he charts a new course for the oil-and-gas giant. Paying out cash is a crowd-pleasing strategy for companies, but they need to be sure they can afford it. BP 's incoming boss may need to give more thought to the oil-and-gas industry's future than the outgoing one.

title: New York City Teachers Pulled From Class to Grade State Tests
summary: Principals say annual ritual saps resources, disrupts learning. The city has asked New York City schools to assign 5,100 English teachers to score state tests for five days this spring, a yearly ritual that principals say disrupts instruction for a week.

title: Starboard Renews Push on EBay's Classified Unit
summary: Hedge fund says eBay's main marketplace and classified unit compete for same customers and product listings. Hedge fund Starboard Value LP reiterated its call for eBay Inc. to shed its classified-advertising business, a move it claims will help the company sharpen its focus on its main online marketplace.

title: Revisit Robert Redford's Retro Ski Style
summary: Why discerning sportsmen are copying the heartthrob's sweatered 1960s look from 'Downhill Racer'. BY 1969, Robert Redford had ascended to the status of both Hollywood leading man and downhill heartthrob. He had just purchased a tract of land in a quiet canyon south of Salt Lake City, now known as Sundance Mountain Resort, that he hoped to turn into an elite Hollywood enclave. That same year he starred in "Downhill Racer" as a small-town Olympic hopeful navigating his way through the refined world of European ski racing.

title: Small Step for Fannie and Freddie, a Leap for Houlihan
summary: Hiring Houlihan Lokey to advise the government is a good marker, but not yet the hardest part of determining Fannie and Freddie's future. Awarding a potential $45 million advisory contract to help the U.S. government sort out the future of housing giants Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac is a major event-for Houlihan Lokey , the investment bank that won the work.

title: OPEC, Allies Weigh Deeper Oil Production Cuts to Counter Coronavirus's Impact
summary: Cartel discusses larger-than-expected output curbs at meeting. OPEC and its allies are debating more aggressive oil output cuts than previously considered after reviewing new data Tuesday that showed the coronavirus's deepening impact on global oil demand, officials at the cartel said.

title: Coronavirus Crisis Could Delay U.S. Boost From Deal With China, Kudlow Says
summary: Economic official said he expected longer-term impact to be minimal. WASHINGTON-White House National Economic Council Director Larry Kudlow said Tuesday he expected the fallout from the deadly coronavirus to delay-but not derail-the economic boost the U.S. anticipated from the first phase of the trade deal with China.

title: TikTok Eyes Larger Post-Super Bowl Marketing Push
summary: The mobile video platform is targeting March Madness and the Tokyo Olympics as part of a broader 2020 marketing push. TikTok plans to increase efforts to promote its brand this year, particularly around large sports events, building on the ad it ran twice during Fox Corp.'s live stream of the Super Bowl.

title: King of Goldman's 'Straders' to Leave Firm
summary: Adam Korn supervised 5,000 engineers working to electronify Goldman trading floor. Goldman Sachs Group Inc.'s "straders," the hybrid trader-coders whose star has been on the rise inside the Wall Street firm, are losing their ringleader.

title: Iran Upholds Death Sentence for Alleged CIA Spy
summary: Iranian citizen is accused of providing U.S. with details on nuclear program; Tehran detained 17 Iranians last year on charges of spying for U.S.. TEHRAN-Iran's top court upheld a death sentence for an Iranian citizen accused of providing the U.S. with details about the Iranian nuclear program at the root of tensions between Tehran and the Trump administration.

title: The Next Generation of Ski Goggles Is Here
summary: These innovative pairs turn a snowy white sea into a navigable line to ski. THE WORLD'S BEST slopes provide awe-inspiring alpine scenery. But to see it-and, more importantly, the conditions below your feet-you need goggles that provide high-quality optics. Skiers and snowboarders are "willing to pay a lot for clarity," said Larry Hartenstein, general manager at Jackson Hole Sports in Wyoming and a ski obsessive who has hit the slopes at more than 180 resorts worldwide. As lens technologies advance, "goggle companies are all chasing the same thing: increased definition and matching the curvature of our eyes." The latest generation of goggles is an arms race to see which company can bring every inch of the mountain into hi-def.

title: EU Reluctance Unsettles Western Balkans' Search for Secure Future
summary: Postponement of long-awaited accession talks leaves North Macedonia and Albania in limbo. SKOPJE, North Macedonia-At town entrances along the highway winding up the snow-topped mountains northwest of here, oversize Albanian flags flutter beside shrines to fallen ethnic Albanian insurgents. They reflect the legacy of a war that ended in 2001, one of several that ravaged the Balkans in the preceding decade.

title: What Investors Saw Inside YouTube's Financials
summary: Google reveals YouTube is smaller than outsiders thought-but still a juggernaut. If YouTube were a stand-alone company, it would be among the biggest advertising players in the world. Yet the online video service isn't as large as many outsiders expected.

title: Democrats Have a Ways to Go Before They Stand United
summary: Passion on the left has propelled the Democratic nominating process so far while the party's center has failed to unite around one clear alternative. In the stretch run before Monday night's Iowa caucuses, the campaign of Sen. Bernie Sanders held an event headlined by Reps. Pramila Jayapal, Rashida Tlaib and Ilhan Omar-three progressives who represent the 20th, 21st and 40th most Democratic congressional districts in the country, respectively. In sum, they come from districts where they don't need to attract any Republican voters, and few independents, to win their seats.

title: Kesha's Favorite Perk of Fame? A Budding Friendship With Nicolas Cage
summary: "He is just a pure, magnetic, strange talented artist in the truest form. I am very attracted to people like that.". Rollicking pop star Kesha was reintroduced to the world-sans the dollar sign in her stage name-in 2017 with "Praying." The ballad, which netted her a 2018 Grammy nomination, served as a coda to her legal battle with her former producer Dr. Luke over her allegations that she was sexually, physically, verbally, and emotionally abused by him. [A lawyer for Dr. Luke did not return a request for comment]

title: New York City Proposes Property-Tax Overhaul, but Details Are Lacking
summary: Plan aims to curb what commission calls opaque system that has favored some homeowners. Some homeowners saw a glimmer of hope last week when New York City released a proposal overhauling its property-tax system, which they say has for decades relied on a complicated and confounding set of rules to calculate assessments.

title: Iowa Democratic Caucuses Result? More Uncertainty
summary: Delayed vote totals leave the state party embarrassed and campaigns spinning their own narratives of the night. What a mess.

title: Popeyes Uniforms Are a Surprise Fashion Hit (Thanks, Beyoncé)
summary: The fast-food chain started selling its uniforms after the pop star launched her similar-looking collection. Only one suggests accessorizing with a chicken sandwich.. The New York fashion shows gearing up to start this week won't be featuring one of the season's most buzzed about offerings: a collection of actual fast-food uniforms.

title: Out of Luck: Virus Shuts Casinos in World's Biggest Gambling Hub
summary: Macau suffers blow in unprecedented closure. MACAU-Casinos in the world's richest gambling market were already down on their luck when city officials ordered them on Tuesday to close their doors at midnight for 15 days to help curb the spread of the coronavirus that has killed hundreds of people in China.

title: New Rule Lets U.S. Companies Fight Currency Manipulation
summary: The Trump administration will allow companies to pursue tariffs against foreign competitors that have benefited from an artificially weakened currency. WASHINGTON-The Trump administration says it will allow companies to pursue tariffs against foreign competitors if they can show those rivals have benefited from currency manipulation in their countries.

title: Bulk Carrier American Commercial Lines to File for Bankruptcy
summary: Bulk shipping company, struggling with industry-wide shipping downturn, strikes deal with lenders to trim debt by $1 billion. Bulk carrier American Commercial Lines Inc. said Tuesday it plans to file for bankruptcy with a deal supported by lenders that would cut about $1 billion of debt from the company's books.

title: How to Handle Air Travel During the Coronavirus Outbreak
summary: You should take many of the same precautions that you would take in other public spaces, but there are safeguards to keep yourself healthy in the air, too. Worried about air travel amid the global health crisis? Wash your hands.

title: It's a Brand-New Porsche From 1959
summary: Resume Subscription. Benjamin Clymer of New York City, 37, founder and CEO of Hodinkee, a lifestyle and luxury watch website and e-commerce platform, on his Porsche 356 Zagato [pronounced Zah-GAT-oh] Coupe, as told to A.J. Baime.

title: The Theater Granted Mandy Patinkin an Escape From Reality
summary: The award-winning actor and singer discusses his relationship with his father, growing up in Chicago's South Shore neighborhood and why he hated school. Mandy Patinkin, 67, is an award-winning actor and singer whose latest album is "Children and Art" (Nonesuch). He currently stars in Showtime's "Homeland," which begins its final season on Feb. 9. He spoke with Marc Myers.

title: Brooklyn Family Found Adopting Teen Costly, Challenging and, Ultimately, Joyous
summary: Resume Subscription. When Joanne Wright decided to adopt a teenage boy with her husband, Chris, she had zero qualms. "Chris had been an uncle. I'd been an aunt forever. We had life experience," she says. "I thought we were going to rock it."

title: Photos: The Ninth of Nine Rare Porsches
summary: This handmade 356 Zagato Coupe is one of only nine built, using an old, nearly forgotten design from an earlier era. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: New Fed Repos Total $94.45 Billion
summary: The Fed intervened in markets with an overnight repurchase agreement operation, or repo, totaling $64.45 billion. The Federal Reserve Bank of New York faced Tuesday more demand for an offering of two-week temporary liquidity than it was willing to supply, as the day's market interventions led overall temporary liquidity levels rise a bit.

title: How Isabella Rossellini Is Using That Master's Degree in Animal Behavior
summary: In her one-woman show, now on the road, the actress impersonates B.F. Skinner and Charles Darwin while her dog dresses up as chicken. Isabella Rossellini isn't a vegan or animal-rights activist. She models cosmetics, and has collaborated with Bulgari on calf-leather and alligator-skin purses. But she owns and runs an organic farm in Long Island, earned a master's degree in animal behavior and conservation at Hunter College, and is devoting her second act to the inner lives of animals.

title: BP Raises Dividend, Boosts Divestment Targets
summary: U.K. energy giant plans to unload more assets amid lower energy prices, weaker refining margins. LONDON- BP PLC raised its dividend on Tuesday at the same time as reporting a small loss and extending its planned asset sales by an additional $5 billion, joining other oil giants in shedding assets to help maintain shareholder returns.

title: Chinese Supermarkets Fined, Warned Against Price Gouging Amid Outbreak
summary: Store ordered to pay $286,000 after pricing some vegetables at nearly eight times their regular level. SHANGHAI-The threat of skyrocketing prices for vegetables and other essentials has prompted authorities in China to impose fines and monitor supermarkets to keep costs down amid a coronavirus outbreak that has people hunkering down across the country.

title: Grocery Chain Earth Fare Files for Chapter 11
summary: Retailer's owners include private-equity firm Oak Hill Capital and former Sears CEO Alan Lacy. Private-equity-backed supermarket chain Earth Fare Inc. filed for bankruptcy a day after saying it planned to close its roughly 50 stores.

title: The Philadelphia Suburbs Where Many Don't Drink the Water
summary: About 80,000 people in three townships live in an area where groundwater has been contaminated by chemicals known as PFAS. WARRINGTON, Pa.-Jessica Watson has cooked with bottled water in her spacious kitchen, with its granite countertops, ever since she became afraid to drink her tap water four years ago.

title: Generate Capital Raises $1 Billion for Clean-Energy Investments
summary: San Francisco-based Generate sees opportunity in increased investing tied to climate change. Generate Capital has raised $1 billion in new funding for clean-energy projects across North America, amid growing corporate and government interest in lowering carbon emissions.

title: A Perfectly Layered Apartment on Paris's Right Bank
summary: A block from the hotel Bristol, design dealer Alexandre Biaggi's Paris apartment was put together one piece at a time, using layers of objects and textures to create shifting moods. "Of course, the chair is ruined, but I love it this way. It's kind of a memento mori," jokes Alexandre Biaggi, stepping around a satin boudoir chair shedding its upholstery in the foyer of his Paris apartment. Biaggi, a 63-year-old design dealer, bought the piece in 1989 for his tiny first shop on the rue Jacob, and he remembers reading a book in it for the better part of his opening day. "Two women came by on the sidewalk and one said to the other one, 'Poor boy. Everything is ugly in that shop.' I didn't know if I was going to cry or to laugh! Then I thought, This one I'm never going to sell."

title: A Rare Look at One of the World's Most Isolated Mountain Treks
summary: The Snowman Trek is one of the most beautiful, isolated and arduous journeys in the Himalayas. And like modern Bhutan, it's slowly becoming more accessible to outsiders.. The Kingdom of Bhutan has 25 unofficial gatekeepers: the 25 pilots certified to land at the country's sole international airport in the scrappy valley town of Paro. A dozen years ago, there were only eight captains deemed capable of the feat, but Bhutan became a constitutional monarchy rather than an absolute one in 2008, and democracy has brought with it many changes, including a growing number of visitors requiring a growing number of pilots. Democracy has had no impact on the mountains, however, and the path to the single short runway remains one of commercial aviation's most challenging. It's more than an approach. It's an arrival.

title: As Gaming Pauses at Sony, Cameras Flash
summary: Japanese giant's decision to hold on to its image-sensor unit, against the recommendation of U.S. activist investors Third Point, is turning out well. Sony 's gaming business is on pause. Luckily, it has other units to pick up the slack.

title: SEC, Startup Gird for Crypto Court Clash
summary: Alleged violation of investor-protection laws at issue in major test of agency's enforcement. WASHINGTON-A startup best known for its popular encrypted messaging application is testing the limits of the U.S. government's crackdown on digital assets, with both sides readying for a court clash in the biggest cryptocurrency case the Securities and Exchange Commission has levied.

title: Home Construction Hums, Lumber Prices Follow
summary: Aided by low mortgage rates, home builders' shares outperformed the broader market last year. Builders are hammering away at more new houses than at any time since before last decade's foreclosure crisis, and the construction boom is driving up lumber prices.

title: Boeing 737 MAX Woes Hit One Sector of Wall Street Deal Making
summary: U.K. manufacturer Senior delays plans to sell aviation unit amid uncertainty over the jet's return to service. LONDON- Boeing Co. 's 737 MAX crisis is spilling into the deals world.

title: Iowa Caucus Results Delayed by Counting Problems
summary: Amid confusion over the results, state party officials say they expect to release them later Tuesday. DES MOINES, Iowa-An election debacle unfolded Monday night as the Iowa Democratic Party failed to release the results of the state's presidential caucuses, saying it had found "inconsistencies in the reporting" as the nation awaited the outcome of the first-in-the-nation nominating contest.

title: Sony's Sales Get Boost From Smartphone Cameras
summary: The Japanese electronics maker raises its profit forecast as smartphones gain more cameras. TOKYO-The rise of smartphones bristling with three or four cameras is producing a windfall for Sony Corp.

title: Buyers Return After Rent-Control Slams New York Apartment Values
summary: The fresh wave of buying challenges some conventional wisdom about price controls and real estate. A number of big real-estate companies are trying something that New York's rent reform bill was thought to make futile: They are buying rent-regulated apartment buildings.

title: Property Investors Lure Startups With Shortcut to Public Listing
summary: Alternative route could bypass the months of public scrutiny and investor roadshows typically required. After WeWork's ill-fated attempt to go public last year, some prominent investors are courting other fast-growing real-estate firms with an alternative path to the stock market.

title: Somebody Needs to Be the Face of Baseball. Enter Christian Yelich.
summary: Baseball needs somebody to emerge as its face. The Brewers outfielder thinks he can take up that mantle.. WESTLAKE VILLAGE, Calif.-While in New York to accept the National League MVP award in the winter following the 2018 season, Christian Yelich chose to make an unusual detour: He visited the Major League Baseball headquarters in Manhattan to meet with the newly reorganized marketing department.

title: Netflix Spends Big for Oscars-Will Hollywood Give In?
summary: With lavish parties, huge billboards, and screenings around the world, awards campaigning may never be the same. Los Angeles

title: Why Payments Are a Bright Spot for Dealmakers
summary: The merger of two French payments companies will create a European rival to U.S. giants as mounting competition rewards scope and scale. Consumers can afford to ignore the payments sector-the often-concealed plumbing of commerce offline and increasingly online. Not so bankers and investors.

title: Logistics Startup ClearMetal Raises Capital to Help Companies Keep Up With Amazon
summary: Eclipse Ventures led the fundraising round as the startup aims to capitalize on logistics arms race. ClearMetal Inc., a logistics and supply chain data analytics startup, raised $15 million in funding, as companies attempt to cut shipping costs, speed up deliveries, and more accurately forecast arrivals to meet higher consumer expectations.

title: The Premier League Is Still Trying to Figure Out the Post-Brexit World
summary: The world's most popular soccer league knows the two departments where Brexit will hit them hardest: the player transfer market and assets held in British pounds. LONDON-At 11 p.m. last Friday night, Britain plowed through two deadlines at the same time. Both were accompanied by frenzied televised countdowns, anxious fans and questions about where various Europeans might be heading.

title: Natural Gas Won't Decarbonize Shipping, But the Fuel Is Here to Stay
summary: Investments in LNG-powered ships are growing despite debate over the impact gas will have on the environment. Shipping is going through its biggest change since switching from coal to heavy oil more than a century ago as it looks for new fuels that will drastically cut the industry's carbon footprint.

title: Wildfires Spared Many Australian Winemakers, but the Smoke Might Not
summary: Smoke contamination is a growing problem for the $336 billion global wine industry as fires break out in grape-growing regions. SYDNEY-Winemaker Dennis Clarke's vineyards didn't burn down in the wildfires ravaging eastern Australia. But the noxious fumes that billowed from the blazes could have him trash much of the 2020 crop anyway.

title: Is Your City's Pension Fund Short? Marijuana Might Help
summary: Public officials look to cannabis tax revenue to shore up retirement programs and budgets. South Beloit, Ill., faces steep bills to fund its firefighter and police pensions and repave its cracked streets. Now, Mayor Ted Rehl has a plan to help cover the shortfall: marijuana.

title: Chinese Lead Foreign Selling of U.S. Commercial Property
summary: Foreign investors are concerned about high prices and new regulations. Chinese investors sold off billions more in U.S. commercial property last year than they bought, as other foreigners start to sour on the U.S. market as well.

title: Home-Loan Banks May Soon Channel Funds to More Mortgage Players
summary: Regulator weighs letting $1.1 trillion network of government-chartered cooperatives, founded to support community lenders, expand to nonbank firms and REITs. RESTON, Va.-On the second floor of a squat office building in a quiet Washington suburb, workers ensconced in cubicles sell millions of dollars of bonds each day, money that later flows to a range of borrowers, from community lenders to global megabanks.

summary: Here are some of the companies with shares expected to trade actively in Tuesday's session. Here are some of the companies with shares expected to trade actively in Tuesday's session. Stock movements noted by ticker reflect movements during regular trading hours.

title: Daniel arap Moi, Former President of Kenya, Dies
summary: While viewed as a dictator, Moi was seen as a uniting figure when he took over from Jomo Kenyatta. NAIROBI, Kenya-Daniel arap Moi, a former schoolteacher who became Kenya's longest-serving president and presided over years of repression and economic turmoil fueled by runaway corruption, has died. He was 95.

title: Peloton, Flywheel Settle Legal Disputes Over Bike Tech
summary: Flywheel acknowledges that it copied Peloton, pledges to remove tech from its bikes. Peloton Interactive Inc., the maker of popular at-home fitness bikes, said Tuesday it has settled legal disputes with Flywheel Sports Inc. over alleged technology theft and patents considered important to success in the growing boutique fitness industry.

title: Tesla's Epic Rally Echoes Past Oil, Bitcoin Bubbles
summary: The car maker's outsize stock gains don't match its fundamentals, but they do share troubling similarities with past episodes of inflated prices that ended in tears. Tesla Inc.'s shares rose 14% Tuesday to $887.06. They have surged 56% in the past week and have nearly quadrupled since early October.

title: Pepper...and Salt
summary: Resume Subscription. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: Google Parent Debuts YouTube, Cloud Results, Reports Weak Earnings
summary: Alphabet posts $46.1 billion in revenue in latest quarter, missing analyst expectations amid efforts to boost transparency. Google pulled back the curtain on several of its important businesses, but not everyone loved what was revealed.

title: Virus Outbreak a Major Test of China's System, Xi Says
summary: Meantime, U.S. authorities report a second case of the virus being passed from one person to another. Chinese leader Xi Jinping described the coronavirus outbreak rampaging through central China as a major test of the country's system of governance, and vowed consequences for officials who shirk responsibility in tackling the crisis.

title: Iowa Caucus 2020: What Time to Tune In and When to Expect Results
summary: Iowa's first-in-the-nation caucuses may yield a first round of results by 9 p.m. ET. Here's how to follow along. Iowa voters join their neighbors tonight in school gymnasiums, libraries, churches and union halls across the state for the first Democratic nominating contest of the 2020 presidential season.

title: In Caucuses' Final Sprint, Candidates Try to Boost Backers' Morale
summary: Campaign volunteers use the last hours to knock on doors and make calls; 'we gotta get folks out'. DES MOINES, Iowa-Pete Buttigieg pushed his supporters to "astonish the political world" at a field office Monday morning. Joe Biden brought boxes of pizza for his volunteers. And Andrew Yang, through bursts of laughter, told his backers to physically drag undecided Democrats to his side.

title: Disney to Bring 'Hamilton' to Movie Theaters
summary: Film will be a recording of original Broadway cast including Lin-Manuel Miranda in title role. "Hamilton," the blockbuster Broadway musical written and composed by Lin-Manuel Miranda about the American founding father Alexander Hamilton, will be brought to the big screen next year by Walt Disney Co.

title: Penn Station Power Problems Cripple Evening Commute
summary: Thousands at the New York rail hub endure delays after an Amtrak power loss. Thousands of rail commuters suffered delays Monday after power problems snarled the evening rush hour at New York Penn Station.

title: New York City Cuts Nonprofit's Jail Work After Founder's Arrest
summary: G-MACC will continue to run antigun programs while city conducts review. A Brooklyn nonprofit will no longer run a counseling program for released Rikers Island inmates after its founder was arrested for allegedly threatening a neighbor, and a staffer was arrested for allegedly conspiring to smuggle drugs into a city jail, New York City officials said Monday.

title: Democrats, Defense Team Make Final Impeachment Arguments
summary: President is set to be acquitted by Senate later this week after vote not to seek new witnesses or documents. WASHINGTON-House managers said President Trump was a threat to American democracy, while his defense team countered that Democrats were trying to undermine two elections, in their final arguments in his Senate impeachment trial on Monday.

title: 'Billion Dollar Brand Club' Review: Clicking the 'Disrupt' Button
summary: How startup companies with new ideas about marketing are upending many segments of the consumer-products industry.. The video, lasting all of 93 seconds, was filmed in a warehouse near Los Angeles International Airport and posted online in 2012. Short on information and long on irreverence, it employed a toddler, a tennis racket, a forklift, and an actor in a bear costume to persuade viewers that they were spending far too much on razor blades. For a dollar a month, the video promised, DollarShaveClub.com would deliver razors to the customer's door. Never mind that the company owned no factory, had no research department, and possessed zero expertise in manufacturing razor blades. Thanks in part to the video's memorable tag line-"Shave time. Shave money."-Dollar Shave Club muscled its way into the tonsorial big leagues. By 2016, four years after the video's posting, razor giant Gillette had lost 13 percentage points of its market share.

title: The Ghost of Richard Cordray
summary: The CFPB sues Citizens Bank five years after lapses were fixed.. Sometimes it feels as if Richard Cordray is commanding his former minions at the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau from exile like Lord Voldemort in Harry Potter. Witness the bureau's lawsuit last week against Citizens Bank for transgressions it long ago disclosed and rectified.

title: China's Economic Contagion
summary: The world will pay a growth price for the Wuhan coronavirus.. Some of President Trump's advisers may want to wall off the U.S. and China into separate spheres of influence, but the novel coronavirus is showing the futility of economic quarantines. Like it or not, the Chinese and world economies sniffle and cough together.

title: Modi Misses Again
summary: India's PM seems to have given up on a pro-growth agenda.. India is facing its worst economic slowdown in years, but you wouldn't know it from reading Narendra Modi's new budget. The Prime Minister may be missing his last best shot at free-market reform.

title: Trump's Medicaid Benefit
summary: Critics distort a new policy giving states more flexibility.. Democrats are rolling out their old health-scare playbook to attack the Trump Administration's Medicaid block-grant proposal last week that would give states more flexibility in exchange for limits on federal funds. Irony alert: The biggest beneficiaries could be Democratic states and low-income Americans.

title: McKinsey's Bankruptcy Business Heads to Trial
summary: Judge to take up McKinsey battle with AlixPartners founder over conflict-of-interest disclosures.

title: Airbus Settlement Signals Greater Collaboration on International Bribery Cases
summary: New legal tools and stronger anticorruption laws in France laid the groundwork for a coordinated resolution to the European plane maker's legal woes. A recent overhaul of anticorruption laws in France helped set the stage for Airbus SE to reach a €3.6 billion ($4 billion) settlement with prosecutors in three countries on the same day-a deal that illustrates the potential upside for companies of increasing collaboration between prosecutors.
